name: Sun
description: The Sun is a yellow dwarf star, a hot ball of glowing gases at the heart of our solar system. Its gravity holds everything from the biggest planets to tiny debris in its orbit. It is by far the most important source of energy for life on Earth.

name: Mercury
description: Mercury is the smallest planet in the Solar System and the closest to the Sun. Although the daylight temperature at the surface of Mercury is generally extremely high, observations strongly suggest that ice (frozen water) exists on Mercury.

name: Venus
description: Venus has the densest atmosphere of the four terrestrial planets, consisting of more than 96% carbon dioxide. A thick atmosphere traps heat in a runaway greenhouse effect, making it the hottest planet in our solar system.

name: Earth
description: Earth – our home and the only astronomical object known to harbor life. About 71% of Earth's surface is made up of the ocean, dwarfing Earth's polar ice, lakes, and rivers. The remaining 29% of Earth's surface is land, consisting of continents and islands.

name: Mars
description: Mars is a dusty, cold, desert world with a very thin atmosphere. There is strong evidence Mars was—billions of years ago—wetter and warmer, with a thicker atmosphere.

name: Jupiter
description: Jupiter is more than twice as massive than the other planets of our solar system combined. Jupiter is so big that all the other planets in the solar system could fit inside it. More than 1,300 Earths would fit inside Jupiter.

name: Saturn
description: Saturn is the second-largest planet in the Solar System, after Jupiter. Adorned with a dazzling, complex system of icy spectacular rings, Saturn is unique in our solar system.

name: Uranus
description: Uranus rotates at a nearly 90-degree angle from the plane of its orbit. This unique tilt makes Uranus appear to spin on its side. Like the other giant planets, Uranus has a ring system it is also the coldest planet in the Solar System

name: Neptune
description:
Neptune is the farthest-known planet
weather is characterised by extremely dynamic storm systems, with winds nearly reaching supersonic flow. The first planet found by mathematical prediction rather than by telescope.

name: Pluto
description: Pluto, once considered the ninth and most distant planet from the sun, is now the largest known dwarf planet in the solar system. It’s very small but complex world of ice mountains and frozen plains.
